storage

Class StorageServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • storage.StorageServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command, Storage

    public class StorageServer
extends Object
implements Storage, Command
    Storage server.

    Storage servers respond to client file access requests. The files accessible through a storage server are those accessible under a given directory of the local filesystem.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StorageServer(File root)
      Creats a storage server, given a directory on the local filesystem.
      StorageServer(File root, int client_port, int command_port)
      Creates a storage server, given a directory on the local filesystem, and ports to use for the client and command interfaces.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StorageServer

        public StorageServer(File root,
             int client_port,
             int command_port)
        Creates a storage server, given a directory on the local filesystem, and ports to use for the client and command interfaces.

        The ports may have to be specified if the storage server is running behind a firewall, and specific ports are open.

        Parameters:
        root - Directory on the local filesystem. The contents of this directory will be accessible through the storage server.
        client_port - Port to use for the client interface, or zero if the system should decide the port.
        command_port - Port to use for the command interface, or zero if the system should decide the port.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If root is null.

      • StorageServer

        public StorageServer(File root)
        Creats a storage server, given a directory on the local filesystem.

        This constructor is equivalent to StorageServer(root, 0, 0). The system picks the ports on which the interfaces are made available.

        Parameters:
        root - Directory on the local filesystem. The contents of this directory will be accessible through the storage server.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If root is null.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(String hostname,
         Registration naming_server)
           throws RMIException,
                  UnknownHostException,
                  FileNotFoundException
        Starts the storage server and registers it with the given naming server.
        Parameters:
        hostname - The externally-routable hostname of the local host on which the storage server is running. This is used to ensure that the stub which is provided to the naming server by the start method carries the externally visible hostname or address of this storage server.
        naming_server - Remote interface for the naming server with which the storage server is to register.
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - If a stub cannot be created for the storage server because a valid address has not been assigned.
        FileNotFoundException - If the directory with which the server was created does not exist or is in fact a file.
        RMIException - If the storage server cannot be started, or if it cannot be registered.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the storage server.

        The server should not be restarted.

      • stopped

        protected void stopped(Throwable cause)
        Called when the storage server has shut down.
        Parameters:
        cause - The cause for the shutdown, if any, or null if the server was shut down by the user's request.

      • size

        public long size(Path file)
          throws FileNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: Storage
        Returns the length of a file, in bytes.
        Specified by:
        size in interface Storage
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the file.
        Returns:
        The length of the file.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file cannot be found or the path refers to a directory.

      • read

        public byte[] read(Path file,
          long offset,
          int length)
            throws FileNotFoundException,
                   IOException
        Description copied from interface: Storage
        Reads a sequence of bytes from a file.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Storage
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the file.
        offset - Offset into the file to the beginning of the sequence.
        length - The number of bytes to be read.
        Returns:
        An array containing the bytes read. If the call succeeds, the number of bytes read is equal to the number of bytes requested.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file cannot be found or the path refers to a directory.
        IOException - If the file read cannot be completed on the server.

      • write

        public void write(Path file,
         long offset,
         byte[] data)
           throws FileNotFoundException,
                  IOException
        Description copied from interface: Storage
        Writes bytes to a file.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Storage
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the file.
        offset - Offset into the file where data is to be written.
        data - Array of bytes to be written.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file cannot be found or the path refers to a directory.
        IOException - If the file write cannot be completed on the server.

      • create

        public boolean create(Path file)
        Description copied from interface: Command
        Creates a file on the storage server.
        Specified by:
        create in interface Command
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the file to be created. The parent directory will be created if it does not exist. This path may not be the root directory.
        Returns:
        true if the file is created; false if it cannot be created.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(Path path)
        Description copied from interface: Command
        Deletes a file or directory on the storage server.

        If the file is a directory and cannot be deleted, some, all, or none of its contents may be deleted by this operation.

        Specified by:
        delete in interface Command
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file or directory to be deleted. The root directory cannot be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the file or directory is deleted; false otherwise.

      • copy

        public boolean copy(Path file,
           Storage server)
             throws RMIException,
                    FileNotFoundException,
                    IOException
        Description copied from interface: Command
        Copies a file from another storage server.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface Command
        Parameters:
        file - Path to the file to be copied.
        server - Storage server from which the file is to be downloaded.
        Returns:
        true if the file is successfully copied; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RMIException - If the call cannot be completed due to a network error, whether between the caller and this storage server, or between the two storage servers.
        FileNotFoundException - If the file is not present on the remote storage server, or the path refers to a directory.
        IOException - If an I/O exception occurs either on the remote or on this storage server.
